Posts.Content: Mar 22, 2011 04:32PM cimo37 wrote: Nil, The beautiful light shining through you, reaching out to us, truly is from our Heavenly Father :-)  Only He can give such great peace and purpose to every breath we take... even in suffering.  I look forward to hearing the rest of your story, already written for you by the Lord Jesus, as each new day unfolds. I pray that you and your husband grow stronger in spirit with each milestone this cancer journey allows you to cross.  Any news you share with faith and hope in your heart is GOOD NEWS!  Because He Loves Us... ~Ci'Monique <><
Posts.Title: 28 YR Old Is Looking For Support from You wwaterlilyy ibcmets

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2010 07:10PM cimo37 wrote: Hi Barb,  Sorry that stress has brought on a case of hives.  That's probably what it is, so try to calm down while you're waiting to see the doctor.  My situation was a bit different, but I would think that if the mammo and US showed a suspicious mass the breast specialist will order a biopsy.  Biopsy is the only definitive way to diagnose breast cancer.  What are your symptoms and the results of your testing so far?  If there isn't a mass or nodule you'll probably just follow up with routine mammos and ultrasounds.  I had lumpy breasts and calicifcations show up on mammo and US for 3 years before a tumor developed.  That led the radiologist to biopsy it on the same day as the ultrasound, and he called me with the results the next day.  When I met my breast surgical oncologist for the first time I was already diagnosed (which makes my situation different from yours).  Just take it one day at a time and don't cause any undue stress on yourself with limited information.  You'll be fine!  God is the giver of unsearchable peace ;-)

I see that you updated a diagnosis a few minutes ago...  So, this means the biopsy was positive for IDC?  Please know that my prayers, and those of others you will probably never meet, are with you. Are you and your husband doing okay?  ~Ci'Monique
